quotes.quote: Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worse kind of suffering.
Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next.

Honesty allows us to live with not knowing. We do not know the full story; we do not know where we are in the story. We do not know who, ultimately, is at fault or who will carry the blame in the end.
Not knowing anything is the sweetest life.
Being at ease with not knowing is crucial for answers to come to you.
The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty; not knowing what comes next.
Sometimes, not knowing what you're doing allows you to do things you never knew you could do.
Our greatest motivation in life comes from not knowing the future.
Although men are accused of not knowing their own weakness, yet perhaps few know their own strength. It is in men as in soils, where sometimes there is a vein of gold which the owner knows not of.
To choose love and jump in not knowing, with a lot of unknowns, is a brave act.
There's nothing better than not knowing what's going to happen until you put the pieces together.
Strange is our situation here on earth. Each of us comes for a short visit, not knowing why, yet sometimes seeming to divine a purpose.
Creativity is the joy of not knowing it all.
A dream is a creation of the intelligence, the creator being present but not knowing how it will end.
Sometimes surrender means giving up trying to understand and becoming comfortable with not knowing.
Sometimes it feels as though happiness is just a word people say to hide the despair of not knowing anything.
If you don't know where you make your mistakes, that's your worst mistake: not knowing where your mistakes are at.
Police officers put the badge on every morning, not knowing for sure if they'll come home at night to take it off.
The challenge that so many people have is not knowing how to take that first step of reaching out to another person for help.
Omnipotence is not knowing how everything is done; it's just doing it.
It's exciting not knowing what tomorrow, or the next month, or the next year holds.
It's not knowing what to do, it's doing what you know.
The difficulties of not knowing are always much greater than the effort of learning.
Things are always changing. Part of being successful here is being comfortable with not knowing what's going to happen.
The real trouble comes from not knowing what we really want in the first place.
